unit.name: 101 Airborne Division HQ
unit.History: The 101st Airborne "screaming eagles" Division is perhaps the most famous of all of the American Divisions that fought in the European Theater during World War 2. Activated along with the 82nd Airborne from the 82nd Infantry Division in 1942, the 101st was sent to England for training in September, 1943. It's first combat assignment was in support of the D-Day invasion where the Division successfully secured the Utah Beach exits in a night drop and later captured the stategic town of Carentan. The 101st was withdrawn from France at the end of June but was brought back into the war in September, 1944 for operation MARKET GARDEN. Again the screaming eagles earned praise for their agressive combat performance defending the Eindhoven sector from multiple German counterattacks. The 101st was withdrawn from Holland at the end of November for rest and re-fitting, and sent to Camp Mourmelon le Grand, France. Less than 3 weeks later, the 101st was rushed north in borrowed trucks into Belgium in response to the German Ardennes counteroffensive. Arriving in Bastogne almost by mistake, the 101st Airborne secured it's place in military history during the week long siege of this strategically important town.

commander.Name: Anthony C. McAuliffe
commander.PersBio: Anthony McAuliffe was Divisional Artillery commander of the 101st, except for a brief period in Normandy when he became Deputy Division Commander. He served as Acting Divisional Commander for the first crucial week in Bastogne while General Taylor was in England.
commander.Title: CO

unit.name: 501 Para Inf Regt HQ
unit.History: Unlike the 502nd and 506th PIR's, the 501st was a Divisional attachment and never an official part of the 101st Division's TO&E. This technicality was always somewhat of a sore point for the CO's of the 501st, but the unit fought with distinction in some of the fiercest battles in Normandy, including the defense of Carentan. In Holland, the 501st defended the DZ's between Veghel and Eerde against some of the heaviest German attacks of the MARKET GARDEN campaign. In the Ardennes, the 501st was the first unit of the 101st to make contact with the Germans east of Bastogne, suffering heavy casualties at the hands of Panzer Lehr.

unit.name: 502 Para Inf Regt HQ
unit.History: Activated as a battalion in 1941, the troops of the 502nd had already undergone significant training when the 101st Division was activated in mid 1942. The 502nd was the first, and origonal Regiment on the official TO&E of the 101st Airborne Division.

unit.name: 506 Para Inf Regt HQ
unit.History: "Currahee" was the motto and insignia of the 506th PIR, named after the mountain the troopers were made to run up during training in preperation for jump school. Very well trained and professionally led, the 506th performed with skill and determination in combat throughout the war, most notably in the capture of Carentan in Normandy,, the Son Bridge in Holland and the defense of the northern flank of the Bastogne perimiter in the Ardennes.

unit.name: E Coy 506 Para Inf Regt
unit.History: "Easy" Company, the famous "Band of Brothers" was known for always being at the sharp end of the 2nd Bn combat assignments.

commander.Name: Norman Dike
commander.PersBio: Dike was transferred from Division HQ to Easy Company shortly before the Battle of the Bulge and became their commanding officer. He was not well regarded by the "Band of Brothers" and was replaced by Ronald Spiers in January 1945 during the attack on Foy.
commander.Title: CO

unit.name: 3 Bn HQ 327 Glider Inf Regt
unit.History: Although named as the 3rd Bn. 327 PIR, this unit consisted of the 1st battalion, 401 Glider infantry regiment. This arrangement had been in place since the unit landed in Normandy.
